revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | name = Larry Murphy | image = Larry Murphy by Gage Skidmore.jpg | imagesize = 220px | caption = Larry Murphy in 2016. | pseudonym = | birth_name = Lawrence Murphy, Jr. | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|3|12|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Abington, Massachusetts]], U.S | death_date = | death_place = | medium = | nationality = [[United States|American]] | active = 1993–present | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = | domestic_partner = | notable_work = ''[[Assy McGee]]'', ''[[Bob's Burgers]]'', ''[[Ugly Americans (TV series)|Ugly Americans]]'' | signature = | website = | footnotes = | current_members = | past_members = }} '''Lawrence "Larry" Murphy, Jr.''' (born March 12, 1972 in [[Abington, Massachusetts]])Zaino, Nick A, III. (November 24, 2006). "Dumbest show on television?", ''[[The Boston Globe]]'', p. D2. is an American actor, voice actor and comedian, known for his work on the TV series ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'', ''[[Ugly Americans (TV series)|Ugly Americans]]'', ''[[Delocated]]'' and ''[[Bob's Burgers]]''. ==Career== Murphy began performing stand-up comedy in 1997 at the Comedy Studio in [[Harvard Square]] in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts]]. Soon after he teamed up with [[Brendon Small]]. Together they performed sketches and rock operas until 2001. Murphy's subsequent independent live work is a mix of sketch and characters. {{citation needed|date=September 2014}} Murphy is a voice actor renowned for his versatility. He voiced all of the main characters on the [[Adult Swim]] comedy series ''[[Assy McGee]]'' and has lent his voice to several [[Soup2Nuts]] animated shows including ''[[O'Grady]]'', ''[[Home Movies (TV series)|Home Movies]]'', and ''[[WordGirl]]''. He voices Teddy in the animated Fox series ''[[Bob's Burgers]]''. He voiced the hostile immigration officer Lt. Francis Grimes on the [[Comedy Central]] series [[Ugly Americans (TV series)|''Ugly Americans'']]. Murphy has appeared as a sketch actor on ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'' and has a recurring role as "Jay the Doorman" on the [[Adult Swim]] live-action series ''[[Delocated]]''. He has toured with comedian [[Eugene Mirman]] and makes an appearance on his 2009 comedy album ''God is a Twelve-Year-Old Boy With Asperger's'', providing the voice of [[Christopher Walken]] taking a customer service call. == Selected filmography == {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" | '''Year''' || '''Title''' || '''Role''' || '''Other notes'''| |- |2016 |[[The Venture Bros.]] |Fallen Archer Various |Voice Actor TV Series |- |rowspan="1"|2011 || ''[[Jon Benjamin Has a Van]]'' || Detective Murphy || Actor
